meta.name: Generate Personalized Strava Ride Titles & Descriptions with DeepSeek AI

name: Strava Social Manager (AI Title & Description Generation)

parameters.text:
=Tu es un assistant virtuel passionné de cyclisme.  
À partir des informations ci-dessous sur ma sortie vélo, génère :
- Un **titre accrocheur** (max 10 mots), original et adapté au contexte de la sortie.
- Une **description** motivante, détaillée et personnalisée (3 à 5 phrases), qui met en valeur les aspects marquants de la sortie (lieux traversés, météo, performance, sensations, anecdotes, etc.).  

Utilise un ton positif, dynamique et inspirant, comme si tu écrivais pour un carnet d’aventure cycliste.  

**Données de la sortie :**
- Distance : [X] km
- Durée : [X] h [X] min
- Dénivelé : [X] m
- Vitesse moyenne : [X] km/h
- Lieu/départ : [Ville/lieu]
- Météo : [ensoleillé, pluvieux, vent, etc.]
- Ressenti : [facile, difficile, super sensations, etc.]
- Particularités : [découverte d’un nouveau parcours, sortie en groupe, crevaison, etc.]

**Format attendu :**
```
Titre : [Titre généré]
Description : [Description générée]
```

---

Voici les données de l'activité : 
{{ $json.data }}

parameters.content:
### **Step 0 – Connecting to the Strava API**
Before anything else, connect your Strava account to n8n via OAuth2:
- Go to **Credentials** > **Strava OAuth2 API** in n8n.
- Enter the Client ID and Client Secret obtained from the Strava developer portal.
- Authorize the necessary scopes (`activity:read_all`, `activity:write`).
- This connection allows n8n to securely access and modify your Strava activities.

### **Step 1 – Strava Trigger**
This node automatically monitors the creation of new activities on your Strava account.
- For each new activity, it retrieves all associated data (distance, duration, elevation gain, etc.).
- It serves as the workflow’s entry point and passes the raw activity data to the next steps.

### **Step 2a – Data Processing (Code)**
A Code node (JavaScript) adds or modifies fields in the activity data.
- Example: Adding a custom field `myNewField` to enrich or prepare the data for use by the AI or other nodes.

### **Step 2b – Data Flattening and Formatting (Combine Everything)**
This Code node "flattens" the complex Strava activity JSON structure into a simple text string.
- It makes the data easily usable by the AI by presenting it as a readable, well-structured text.
- Each activity key/value is listed on a line, making contextual analysis easier.

### **Step 3 – AI Generation of Title and Description (Strava Social Manager)**
This node calls an AI agent (via OpenRouter or other service) with a detailed prompt:
- It sends the activity data (flattened previously) to the AI.
- The AI generates a catchy title and a personalized description, inspired by the context, performance, and highlights of the ride.
- The prompt is designed to get an inspiring result tailored to the cycling community.

### **Step 4 – Extracting AI Results (Edit Fields)**
The Set node extracts the AI-generated title and description from the output text.
- It splits the text to isolate the title and description, storing them in separate fields.
- This step prepares the data for updating on Strava.

### **Step 5 – Automatic Update of the Activity on Strava**
The Strava node updates the relevant activity with the generated title and description.
- It uses the activity ID provided by the initial trigger.
- The `name` (title) and `description` fields are updated directly on Strava, making the ride more attractive and personalized.
